DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the parameningeal extension evidence of rhabdomyosarcoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, the structures proximal to meninges._To increase in length or duration.:A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomic sites._Knowledge on which to base belief.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, the structures proximal to meninges._To increase in length or duration.

Concepts.definition: Of, or related to, the structures proximal to meninges.
To increase in length or duration.

Property.preferredDefinition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomic sites._Knowledge on which to base belief.

Concepts.definition: A rare aggressive malignant mesenchymal neoplasm arising from skeletal muscle. It usually occurs in children and young adults. Only a small percentage of tumors arise in the skeletal muscle of the extremities. The majority arise in other anatomic sites.
Knowledge on which to base belief.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Of, or related to, the structures proximal to meninges._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The direct spread of a malignant tumor from an adjacent site into the cranium.

Concepts.definition: The direct spread of a malignant tumor from an adjacent site into the cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Injury to any of the cranial nerves or their nuclei in the brain resulting in muscle weakness.

Concepts.definition: Injury to any of the cranial nerves or their nuclei in the brain resulting in muscle weakness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the cranium._The underlying or supportive part of an anatomic structure._An eating away or breakdown of any type of external or internal human tissue including but not limited to skin, teeth, mucosa, or somatic, which involves only the outer tissue layer. When tissue surrounds an implanted device, the tissue breakdown may result in migration and loss of the implant material and may result in further complications such as infection or abscess.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the cranium.
The underlying or supportive part of an anatomic structure.

An eating away or breakdown of any type of external or internal human tissue including but not limited to skin, teeth, mucosa, or somatic, which involves only the outer tissue layer. When tissue surrounds an implanted device, the tissue breakdown may result in migration and loss of the implant material and may result in further complications such as infection or abscess.
